I couldn’t steer a ship myself, of course, but there were plenty of other people 
on board who could, as long as I could persuade them, which I did, to a point. I 
don’t know where I got the gun, but once Captain Macaby was dead the others 
were very keen to sail wherever I wanted. The doom held me tight and pulled 
us all slowly, inevitably, towards our grave. And when we got there, we cut the 
engines and began to wait. I could feel all of their eyes look to me, panicked, 
hoping for some sort of explanation. 
I almost tried to give them one, but I barely got the first word out before the 
falling satellite debris hit the ship at 200 miles an hour, killing us instantly. 
OLIVER 

The Magnus Archives – 121 – Far Away 
 
11 
 
Right. That’s it, I suppose. Maybe you heard me. Maybe you’ll dream. Then 
again, maybe I just wasted my breath, but I don’t think so. 
Honestly, I’m still not exactly sure why I’m here, but you know better than 
anyone how the spiders can get into your head. Easier to just do what she asks. 
The thing is, John, right now, you have a choice. You’ve put it off a long time, 
but it’s trapping you here. You’re not quite human enough to die, but still too 
human to survive. You’re balanced on an edge where The End can’t touch you, 
but you can’t escape him. I made a choice. We all make choices. Now you have 
t— 
[Door opens and faint hospital noises can be heard] 
GEORGIE 
(Suspicious) Can I help you? 
OLIVER 
Uh, uh, I’m a friend… of John’s. 
GEORGIE 
Are you now? 
OLIVER 
Y-y-yes. 
GEORGIE 
Right. Just… haven’t seen you visiting before. 
OLIVER 

The Magnus Archives – 121 – Far Away 
 
12 
 
I’ve been out of town. 
GEORGIE 
Right. (Pause) The nurse didn’t say anyone else was here. 
OLIVER 
Oh, oh, oh, well… Sorry if I surprised you. 
GEORGIE 
It’s fine. 
OLIVER 
I’m Antonio. 
GEORGIE 
Sure. 
OLIVER 
Do you mind, um, giving us a minute? 
GEORGIE 
No, I think you’re done here. 
OLIVER 
Oh, uh, right. Have I upset you, miss? 
GEORGIE 
No, you just remind me of someone. 

The Magnus Archives – 121 – Far Away 
 
13 
 
OLIVER 
Ah. I’m sorry, were they— 
GEORGIE 
Evil, yes. 
OLIVER 
Oh. Okay, then. I… I just, uh, I guess I should just go. 
GEORGIE 
I guess you should. 
OLIVER 
(To Archivist) Make your choice, John. 
[Door opens and closes; Georgie exhales] 
GEORGIE 
Sorry about that. But you really don’t need friends like tha— … Did...? 
[Door opens] 
GEORGIE (BACKGROUND) 
Hey! Hey, get back here, I need to talk to you! 
[Door closes] 
[Ticking of clock continues. Static crackle, followed by gasps and several deep 
breaths. Tape clicks off.]
